text: Unfortunately, it's not possible to do this today <@U04L9MBL308> since this is the HubSpot design style for the DescriptionList component. I hear you, it would be good to have more options to align and I have logged your feedback for the future. Sorry about that and let me know if I can help with anything else
Thank you, Philiip, your feedback has been passed to the right team and we will keep you posted on the outcomes.
What would you have the button do, Sebestian?
Also, this is fairly relevant point, so all good to post here, you are in the right place
IMO, the button would pop up a modal, or open a panel, or scroll a middle or right side card into view

> I have in the Contacts section a card to connect to my internal API and the Sales guys would like to be able to access the same without having to switch from Leads to Contacts.
Ah I see you have that. Can you share more about the card? a screenshot?

There are two ways this can be tackled
1. Open a modal or side panel on the button click
2. Add card directly on the sidebar
It does depend on your use case though
Hi all. I want to post a form while the user hit enter key in an input or a textarea. What should I do?
Hi! Can you tell me more about your use case? How would that be helpful?
Hi Aanchal, I'm making a chatbot that user can ask questions. The form has only one field to enter the question. I'd like the user can send the question when he press enter in the input.
Seems that Input/TextArea components don't have KeyUP/KeyDown event to bind.
Got it, thanks for the context! We're looking into this on our end. I will get back to you on this. Thank you for your patience
